channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Covid: Jabs for 16 and 17-year-olds to start within weeks
item.description: About 1.4 million more teenagers will be eligible for the Pfizer vaccine and will not need parental consent.

item.title: Ivi Miley death: Man jailed for killing baby daughter
item.description: Anthony Miley is jailed for manslaughter after three-month-old Ivi died from catastrophic injuries.

item.title: Alta Fixsler: European court rejects appeal over Jewish girl's life support
item.description: Medics say Alta Fixsler has no chance of recovery but her parents want her to be treated abroad.

item.title: Streatham terror attack: Sudesh Amman 'told mentor he had changed'
item.description: Sudesh Amman convinced two mentors he had changed before stabbing two people, an inquest hears.

item.title: Lee Collins: Yeovil Town captain's death was suicide, records coroner
item.description: An inquest heard Yeovil Town captain Lee Collins also had drugs and alcohol in his system.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Liverpool millionaire aiding GB's medal haul
item.description: Barrie Wells sponsored Olympic silver medallist Keely Hodgkinson after she failed to get funding.

item.title: Croydon tram crash: Victims' families call for new inquest
item.description: An inquest found the crash which killed seven people in south London was an accident.

item.title: Covid jabs given to 100 seafarers in Cornwall
item.description: The vaccine is given to seafarers who are at sea for months, regardless of their nationality.

item.title: Top Gear production to move to Bristol from 2022
item.description: The long-running BBC motoring show will move out of London next year.

item.title: Ever Given: Cargo unloaded from ship that blocked Suez Canal
item.description: The Ever Given arrived at Felixstowe on Tuesday and is expected to leave on Thursday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Where are Team GB’s English medallists from?
item.description: With day 11 of the competition over, the North West currently leads the way when it comes to medals.

item.title: Woman watching Love Island nearly hit as car smashes into living room
item.description: Rhia Brindley is told if she had been in her usual spot to watch TV, she would be "injured or dead".

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: Covid: Wigan nurse's photos capture life in intensive care unit
item.description: Nurse Petro Bekker's photos of her team in the intensive care unit are to feature in an exhibition.

item.title: Wigan family rescue deer from drowning in canal
item.description: Chris and Denver Kendall, from Wigan, tied two dog leads together to pull the animal to safety.

item.title: Dog-snatching thief filmed by doorbell camera in Horndean
item.description: A 13-year-old boy was walking his border terrier Melchy when he was pushed out of the way.

item.title: Basketball: Chatham teenager gets scholarship to play for top US side
item.description: Tamara Fournillier-Onadeko, who plays at youth level in the GB squad, is heading to Chicago.

item.title: Exhibition celebrates women of fishing industry
item.description: An exhibition is dedicated to decades of women who have worked in the industry on the east coast.

item.title: Tipton house fire: Woman arrested after man and dog killed
item.description: An 18-year-old woman is held on suspicion of arson after the deadly blaze in Tipton, West Midlands.

item.title: Migrant Channel crossings: 281 people reach the UK
item.description: The Home Office says the rising number of people making the "dangerous" crossing is unacceptable.

item.title: Vigil held for sisters murdered in park
item.description: Family and friends gather at a vigil to honour women lost to male violence.

item.title: Bradford child sexual abuse: 19 men arrested
item.description: The inquiry is connected to offences against one female in Bradford between 2000-2005, police say.

item.title: Nigha Hussain jailed for abusing and trying to rape girl in Bradford
item.description: Nigha Hussain began abusing the youngster in Bradford when she was aged eight, police say.

item.title: Seal freed after week trapped on Stockton rafting course
item.description: The RSPCA said another seal was seen waiting for it in the river and the pair swam off together.

item.title: Ex-Warwickshire Police officer convicted of second charge
item.description: Alan Butler was charged after relationships he had with two women whose cases he was involved in.

item.title: '13th Century castle' remains discovered in Shropshire
item.description: "A substantial wall and blocks of wood" are uncovered in the dig near Soulton Hall, Shropshire.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Britain's Katarina Johnson-Thompson withdraws injured from heptathlon
item.description: Katarina Johnson-Thompson withdraws from the Olympic heptathlon with a calf injury that caused her to pull up in the 200m.

item.title: Jack Grealish: Manchester City closing in on £100m signing of Aston Villa captain
item.description: Manchester City are closing in on the £100m signing of Aston Villa skipper Jack Grealish.

item.title: Huge sixes and a new high score - Willey inspires Superchargers to win over Spirit
item.description: David Willey's extraordinary hitting fires Northern Superchargers to a crushing 63-run win over London Spirit in the men's Hundred.
